headline: Southern’s Record US$26.5b DOE Loan And What It Means For Valuation
summary: Southern Company (NYSE:SO) has secured a record $26.5b loan commitment from the U.S. Department of Energy. The funds are earmarked for grid upgrades, reliability improvements, and new power resources across Georgia and Alabama. This is the largest federal loan Southern's subsidiaries have received for energy infrastructure projects. Southern, trading at $96.35, has seen returns of 1.4% over the past week and 8.5% over the past month. Longer term, the stock shows returns of 10.5% year to...
